detaileddescription.para:
ev
event record pointer
This macro clears the given event record pointer to the default status.

briefdescription.para: set the tag for given event

detaileddescription.para:
ev
event record
t
event tag
This macro sets the tag to the given event record.

ev
event record
c
destination client id
p
destination port id
This macro sets the client and port id numbers to the given event record.

ev
event record
This macro sets the destination as the subscribers.

ev
event record
This macro sets the destination as the broadcasting.

ev
event record
p
source port id
This macro sets the source port id number.

ev
event instance
This macro sets the event to the direct passing mode to be delivered immediately without queueing.

ev
event instance
q
queue id to schedule
relative
relative time-stamp if non-zero
ttick
tick time-stamp to be delivered
This macro sets the scheduling of the event in the MIDI tick mode.

ev
event instance
q
queue id to schedule
relative
relative time-stamp if non-zero
rtime
time-stamp to be delivered
This macro sets the scheduling of the event in the realtime mode.

event instance
Sets the event length mode as fixed size.

event instance

Sets the event length mode as variable length and stores the data.

ev
event instance

length of the external data

Sets the event length mode as variable user-space data and stores the data.

briefdescription.para: set the real-time position of a queue
set the tick-time position of a queue
change the tempo of the specified queue

parameterdescription.para: pitch bend; zero centered from -8192 to 8191

detaileddescription.para:
ev
event record
datalen
length of sysex data
dataptr
sysex data pointer
the sysex data must contain the start byte 0xf0 and the end byte 0xf7.

memberdef.argsstring: (snd_seq_t *seq, int q, int type, int value, snd_seq_event_t *ev)
memberdef.name: snd_seq_control_queue

detaileddescription.para:
seq
sequencer handle
q
queue id to control
type
event type
value
event value
ev
event instance
This function sets up general queue control event and sends it. To send at scheduled time, set the schedule in ev. If ev is NULL, the event is composed locally and sent immediately to the specified queue. In any cases, you need to call snd_seq_drain_output() appropriately to feed the event.

the created port number or negative error code Creates a port with the given capability and type bits.

simplesect.para: 0 on success or negative error code

briefdescription.para: wait until all events are processed

detaileddescription.para:
seq
sequencer handle
0 on success or negative error code This function waits until all events of this client are processed.

briefdescription.para: parse the given string and get the sequencer address

detaileddescription.para:
seq
sequencer handle
addr
the address pointer to be returned
arg
the string to be parsed
0 on success or negative error code This function parses the sequencer client and port numbers from the given string. The client and port tokens are separated by either colon or period, e.g. 128:1. When seq is not NULL, the function accepts also a client name not only digit numbers. Actually arg need to be only a prefix of the wanted client. That is, if a client named "Foobar XXL Master 2012" with number 128 is available, then parsing "Foobar" will return the address 128:0 if no other client is an exact match.

seq
sequencer handle
0 on success or negative error code So far, this works identically like snd_seq_drop_output().

seq
sequencer handle
0 on success or negative error code So far, this works identically like snd_seq_drop_input().
